parts.name: Photographs
parts.instructions: Listen and choose the statement that best describes the picture.

context.imageDescription: A woman is arranging flowers in small vases on a wooden counter inside a cafe.

questions.stem: What is true about the picture?
options: A. The woman is paying at the register.
B. The woman is arranging flowers.
C. The woman is closing the window.
D. The woman is serving customers.
questions.explanationJa: 花を小さな花瓶に生けている描写。Bが最も合致。

context.imageDescription: A man is typing on a laptop at a tidy office desk with a cup of coffee beside him.

questions.stem: What is true about the picture?
options: A. The man is talking on the phone.
B. The man is typing on a laptop.
C. The man is drawing a chart.
D. The man is opening a window.
questions.explanationJa: 男性はノートPCで入力している。Bが正解。

context.imageDescription: Vendors are displaying vegetables at an outdoor street market; a customer is examining tomatoes.

questions.stem: What is true about the picture?
options: A. The stalls are being closed.
B. A customer is examining produce.
C. People are sitting at a restaurant.
D. A truck is being loaded with boxes.
questions.explanationJa: 屋外市場で客が野菜を手に取っている描写。Bが適切。

context.imageDescription: Passengers are lining up at an airport check-in counter with suitcases.

questions.stem: What is true about the picture?
options: A. The passengers are boarding the plane.
B. The passengers are checking in.
C. The passengers are taking seats in a theater.
D. The passengers are claiming luggage.
questions.explanationJa: 空港のチェックインカウンターに並んでいる。Bが妥当。

context.imageDescription: Construction workers are wearing helmets and standing on scaffolding beside a building.

questions.stem: What is true about the picture?
options: A. Workers are seated at their desks.
B. Workers are standing on scaffolding.
C. Workers are unloading a ship.
D. Workers are painting a portrait.
questions.explanationJa: 足場に立つ作業員の描写。Bが正解。

parts.name: Question-Response
parts.instructions: Listen to a question or statement and choose the best response.

options: B. In the main conference room.
questions.explanationJa: “いつ”に対する回答として時刻/曜日が適切。Aが最も自然。Bは場所、Cは無関係。

context.audioTranscript: Could you send me the invoice today?

options: A. Yes, I'll e-mail it by noon.
B. The printer is on the left.
C. No, I didn't see the noise.
questions.explanationJa: 依頼に対する肯定応答が自然。Bは場所、Cは意味不明。

context.audioTranscript: Who will present the quarterly report?

questions.explanationJa: “誰が”に対して人物で答えるBが適切。Aは時間、Cは場所。

context.audioTranscript: Do you mind if I open the window?

options: B. It's on the second floor.
questions.explanationJa: 許可を求める表現への自然な応答。Aが最適。

context.audioTranscript: Where did you put the signed contracts?

questions.explanationJa: “どこに”に対する場所の回答。Bが適切。Aは期限、Cは理由で不適切。

parts.name: Conversations
parts.instructions: Listen to a conversation and choose the best answer to the question.

conversation.speaker: W
conversation.text: The printer on the third floor is jammed again.

conversation.speaker: M
conversation.text: I'll call IT right away. We can't delay the reports.

context.question: What will the man probably do?

questions.explanationJa: 男性が“call IT”と言及。Bが正解。

conversation.speaker: M
conversation.text: Did you receive the shipping confirmation?

conversation.speaker: W
conversation.text: Not yet, but the supplier said it would be sent by 5 p.m.

context.question: What is the status of the shipping confirmation?

options: A. It was delivered this morning.
B. It hasn't been received yet.
C. It was canceled by the supplier.
D. It needs to be printed.
questions.explanationJa: “Not yet”とあるので未受領。Bが妥当。

conversation.speaker: W
conversation.text: We should move the presentation to Tuesday.

conversation.speaker: M
conversation.text: Good idea. The clients will be back by then.

context.question: When will the presentation likely be held?

questions.explanationJa: “move ... to Tuesday”よりBが正しい。

conversation.speaker: M
conversation.text: Do you want me to reserve a projector for the workshop?

conversation.speaker: W
conversation.text: Yes, and please book a larger room as well.

context.question: What additional request does the woman make?

options: B. To book a larger room.
questions.explanationJa: 女性が“book a larger room”と依頼。Bが正解。

conversation.speaker: W
conversation.text: Your flight to Osaka has been delayed by one hour.

conversation.speaker: M
conversation.text: That's fine. Could you notify my driver?

context.question: What does the man ask the woman to do?

questions.explanationJa: 男性が“notify my driver”と依頼。Cが正解。

parts.name: Talks
parts.instructions: Listen to a short talk and choose the best answer to the question.

context.talk: Welcome to the city museum. The gift shop is located near the exit on the first floor.
context.question: Where is the gift shop located?

options: B. Near the exit on the first floor.
C. Next to the ticket counter.
questions.explanationJa: “first floor ... near the exit”と明示。Bが正解。

context.talk: This is a reminder that the maintenance crew will inspect the elevators tomorrow between 9 and 11 a.m.
context.question: What will happen tomorrow morning?

options: A. A staff meeting will begin.
D. The office will be closed.
questions.explanationJa: “inspect the elevators”とあるのでB。

context.talk: Our new smartphone features a longer-lasting battery and a brighter display.
context.question: What is mentioned about the smartphone?

options: A. It has a larger camera sensor.
C. It is available in fewer colors.
D. It is heavier than before.
questions.explanationJa: “longer-lasting battery”に対応。Bが正解。

context.talk: Due to severe weather, the 6 p.m. ferry has been canceled. We apologize for the inconvenience.
context.question: What is the announcement about?

questions.explanationJa: 悪天候で便がキャンセル＝スケジュール変更。Aが正解。

context.talk: Before we begin, please make sure your microphones are muted and cameras turned off to save bandwidth.
context.question: What are listeners asked to do?

questions.explanationJa: “microphones are muted”と指示。B。

parts.name: Incomplete Sentences
parts.instructions: Choose the word or phrase that best completes the sentence.

questions.stem: The new software update will be available to all users ______ next week.
questions.explanationJa: “during next week”は英語として不自然に感じる学習者もいるが、期間中を表せる。より自然なのは“sometime next week/early next week”。ここでは文脈上“来週の間に”の意味でD。※実務では“starting next week”なども可。

questions.stem: Employees are encouraged to submit feedback ______ the online portal.
questions.explanationJa: “through the portal（ポータルを通じて）”が自然。

questions.stem: The manager approved the proposal after carefully ______ the costs.
questions.explanationJa: 前置詞afterの後は動名詞/名詞句。意味的にも“after evaluating”。

questions.stem: Our sales have increased steadily, ______ our market share remains small.
questions.explanationJa: 対比（売上は伸びているが市場シェアは小さい）なのでalthough。

questions.stem: Ms. Chen will lead the project if Mr. Gomez is ______ to travel.
questions.explanationJa: “if Mr. Gomez is unable to travel（渡航できない場合）”が文意に合う。

parts.name: Text Completion
parts.instructions: Read the text and choose the best option to complete the blank.

context.text: To all staff: Please 【_____】 your timesheets by Friday so payroll can be processed on time. Thank you.

questions.explanationJa: タイムシートは“submit（提出）”。

context.text: Dear Customer, Your order has been shipped and should arrive 【_____】 three business days.

questions.explanationJa: “within three business days（3営業日以内に）”。

context.text: Reminder: The parking lot will be closed for cleaning this weekend. Please 【_____】 alternative arrangements.

questions.explanationJa: “make arrangements（手配する）”のコロケーション。

context.text: We apologize for the delay in responding to your inquiry and appreciate your 【_____】.

questions.explanationJa: “appreciate your patience（ご辛抱に感謝）”。名詞が必要。

context.text: Our company is 【_____】 a new line of eco-friendly packaging next quarter.

questions.explanationJa: 進行予定を表す現在進行形の用法。“is launching”が自然。Cでも文脈により可だが、ここはAが最適。

parts.name: Reading Comprehension
parts.instructions: Read the passage and choose the best answer.

context.passage: Notice: The downtown library will close at 5 p.m. on Friday for a private event. Regular hours resume Saturday.

questions.stem: What will happen on Friday evening?
options: A. The library will host a private event.
B. The library will extend its hours.
C. The library will open a new branch.
D. The library will be under renovation.
questions.explanationJa: “close at 5 p.m. for a private event”→私的イベント開催。A。

context.passage: Email: Hi team, I've attached the draft agenda. Please send edits by Tuesday so we can finalize it. —Rina

questions.stem: What does Rina ask the team to do?
questions.explanationJa: “send edits by Tuesday”と依頼。Bが正解。

context.passage: Flyer: Join our 5K charity run on May 12. Registration includes a T-shirt and refreshments.

questions.explanationJa: チラシ記載通り。Cが正解。

context.passage: Message: The elevator is out of service. Please use the stairs or the freight elevator located at the end of the hall.

questions.stem: What are people advised to do?
options: A. Wait until the elevator is repaired.
B. Use alternative ways to reach other floors.
questions.explanationJa: 階段または貨物用エレベーターの利用を推奨。B。

context.passage: Review: The headphones deliver clear sound and are comfortable for long use, but the battery life could be better.

questions.stem: What is one criticism mentioned in the review?
options: A. The sound quality is poor.
C. The battery life is not ideal.
D. The price is too high.
questions.explanationJa: 電池持ちに対する不満が言及。Cが正解。

metadata.noteJa: 本データはETSの公式問題からの引用ではなく、TOEIC形式を参考にしたオリジナル問題です。
